result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Jackson, Ivan S

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ivan S Jackson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for Ivan S Jackson.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for bail/bond hearing. Court hears arguments as to bail. For reasons as set forth on the record, Court DENIES defense's motion to modify bail. Defense received all of discovery. Scheduling conference remains calendared for November 18, 2022 at 8:30 am; VIA ZOOM.
Filed: Original Transcript of Preliminary Hearing ( 19 pages) commencing 10-05-2022 by Kristin Menzia.
Email correspondence with parties. Case scheduled for a Bail Bond Hearing on 10/21/2022 at 01:45 pm, Br 16.
Received and Filed. Motion for Reduction of Bail

Defendant Ivan S Jackson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for Ivan S Jackson.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Kyle Veloz - MPD Officer. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ivan S Jackson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for Ivan S Jackson. Attorney Annie Louk appeared on behalf of  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for State V. Lee hearing. Defendant was not produced for hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris  has been appointed by the Public Defender's Office. Parties selected Preliminary hearing date. Case adjourned for Preliminary Hearing, Branch 16.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion for Dismissal.  (Ivan S. Jackson - #2022008875, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).
Received and Filed. SPD Order Appointing Counsel

Defendant Ivan S Jackson not in court, in custody in HOC.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Status Conference. SPD has not appointed counsel. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ivan S Jackson not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for status of counsel in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Status conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ivan S Jackson not in court, defendant in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests that the matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing or status; denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Ivan S Jackson in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant Ivan S Jackson in custody.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ivan S Jackson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case will be heard in room 503 of the courthouse.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
